to check the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender.","params":{"owner":"The address which owns the funds.","spender":"The address which will spend the funds."},"returns":{"remaining":"A uint256 specifying the amount of tokens still available for the spender."}},"approve(address,uint256)":{"details":"Approve the passed address to spend the specified amount of tokens on behalf of msg.sender. Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729","params":{"spender":"The address which will spend the funds.","value":"The amount of tokens to be spent."}},"approveAndCall(address,uint256,bytes)":{"details":"ApproveAndCall the passed address to spend the specified amount of tokens on behalf of msg.sender and call the receiveApproval function on that contract. This allows users to use their tokens to interact with contracts in one function call instead of two. Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729","params":{"data":"Extra data to be sent along the call.","spender":"The address which will spend the funds.","value":"The amount of tokens to be spent."}},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"Gets the balance of the specified address.","params":{"owner":"The address to query the the balance of."},"returns":{"balance":"An uint256 representing the amount owned by the passed address."}},"claimPar(address)":{"details":"Note that this will fail when the contract has not enough currency balance to pay out the entire un-claimed      principal balance.","params":{"holder":"The address of the account to send  the principal amount to."}},"constructor":{"params":{"couponPeriod":"The coupon period is the frequency that the bond issuer will make coupon payments to bondholders.                         Typically, this is either semi-annual or annual. (number of months between coupons)","couponRate":"The coupon rate is the annual rate of interest (expressed as a percentage) the bond issuer                         pays out to bondholders on the principal amount of the bond at each coupon payment date. Coupon                         payments compensate investors for the risk of loaning capital to the issuer. (percentage * 100)","decimals":"The granularity into which a single bond can be tokenized.","gateKeeper":"The gatekeeper is the smart contract which handles the permissions on this bond.","ipfsFieldContainerHash":"The IPFS hash to all the fields that are not on chain.","maturityPeriod":"The maturity period is an amount of months after the issuance date when the bond matures and the                         bond issuer must pay the principal amount to bondholders. (number of months after the issuance date)","name":"A clear name of for the bond for humans.","parCurrency":"The currency of the par value","parValue":"The principal amount is the amount paid out to the holder of the bond at its maturity date.                         It is also known as the \u201cpar value\u201d. The principal amount is the reference amount used to                         calculate interest payments. (amount * 10^decimals of the currency)","uiFieldDefinitionsHash":"The IPFS hash to the field definitions for the UI"}},"edit(string,uint256,address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint8,string)":{"params":{"couponPeriod":"The coupon period is the frequency that the bond issuer will make coupon payments to bondholders. (percentage * 100)","decimals":"The granularity into which a single bond can be tokenized.","ipfsFieldContainerHash":"The IPFS hash to all the fields that are not on chain.","maturityPeriod":"The maturity period is an amount of months after the issuance date when the bond matures and the                         bond issuer must pay the principal amount to bondholders. (number of months after the issuance date)","name":"A clear name of for the bond for humans.","parCurrency":"The currency of the par value","parValue":"The principal amount is the amount paid out to the holder of the bond at its maturity date. (amount * 10^decimals of the currency)"}},"getByIndex(uint256)":{"details":"Gets balance of an individual bond holder, used by the middleware to build a cache you can query.      You should not need this function in general since iteration this way clientside is very slow.","params":{"index":"used to access the tokenHolders array"},"returns":{"balance":"   the holder's balance","holder":"    holder's address"}},"getByKey(address)":{"details":"Gets balance of an individual bond holder, used by the middleware to build a cache you can query.      You should not need this function in general since iteration this way clientside is very slow.","params":{"key":"used to access the token's balances"},"returns":{"balance":"   the holder's balance","holder":"    holder's address and balance"}},"getIndexLength()":{"details":"Gets the amount of bond holders, used by the middleware to build a cache you can query.      You should not need this function in general since iteration this way clientside is very slow.","returns":{"length":"An uint256 representing the amount of tokenholders recorded in this contract."}},"increaseApproval(address,uint256)":{"details":"approve should be called when allowed[spender] == 0. To increment allowed value it's better to use this function to avoid 2 calls (and wait until the first transaction is mined). From MonolithDAO ERC20Token.sol"},"launch(uint256)":{"params":{"launchDate":"the launch date or announcement date is the date at which the details regarding a new issue                   are released to investors."}},"redeemCoupons(address)":{"details":"Note that this will fail when the contract has not enough currency balance to pay out the entire un-redeemed      balance of the coupon.","params":{"holder":"The address of the account to redeem all unredeemed and vested coupons for."}},"setIssuanceDate(uint256)":{"params":{"issuanceDate":"The date the bond is officially issued. This marks the start of the maturityPeriod (unix timestamp)"}}},"title":"Bond","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"claimPar(address)":{"notice":"Returns the principal amount to the holder and burns the bond tokens"},"constructor":{"notice":"Creates a new bond"},"edit(string,uint256,address,uint256,uint256,uint256,uint8,string)":{"notice":"Updates most of the settings of a bond if the bond has not launched yet and the user had the EDIT_ROLE."},"getByIndex(uint256)":{"notice":"Returns the address and balance of the tokenholder by index"},"getByKey(address)":{"notice":"Returns the address and balance of the tokenholder by address"},"getIndexLength()":{"notice":"Returns the amount of bond holders."},"launch(uint256)":{"notice":"Releases the issuance to investors at a certain date and time"},"redeemCoupons(address)":{"notice":"Redeems the coupons for the supplied holder that have not been redeemed yet and have vested."},"updateCoupons()":{"notice":"Function to run on each transfer, mint, burn and mature (action that changes the holders) to update the coupons         with the holders at that time. It does not matter if there is no movement, because then it will be the current         holder list."}},"notice":"A bond is a debt security that corporations and governments use to raise capital. It provides an investor         the means to loan money to an issuer for a defined period of time. In return, the investor will receive variable         or fixed interest payments periodically throughout the loaning allowance(address,address).details: Function to check the amount of tokens that an owner allowed to a spender.

params.owner: The address which owns the funds.
params.spender: The address which will spend the funds.

returns.remaining: A uint256 specifying the amount of tokens still available for the spender.

approve(address,uint256).details: Approve the passed address to spend the specified amount of tokens on behalf of msg.sender. Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729

params.spender: The address which will spend the funds.
params.value: The amount of tokens to be spent.

approveAndCall(address,uint256,bytes).details: ApproveAndCall the passed address to spend the specified amount of tokens on behalf of msg.sender and call the receiveApproval function on that contract. This allows users to use their tokens to interact with contracts in one function call instead of two. Beware that changing an allowance with this method brings the risk that someone may use both the old and the new allowance by unfortunate transaction ordering. One possible solution to mitigate this race condition is to first reduce the spender's allowance to 0 and set the desired value afterwards: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729

params.data: Extra data to be sent along the call.
params.spender: The address which will spend the funds.
params.value: The amount of tokens to be spent.

balanceOf(address).details: Gets the balance of the specified address.

params.owner: The address to query the the balance of.

returns.balance: An uint256 representing the amount owned by the passed address.

claimPar(address).details: Note that this will fail when the contract has not enough currency balance to pay out the entire un-claimed      principal balance.

params.holder: The address of the account to send  the principal amount to.

params.couponPeriod: The coupon period is the frequency that the bond issuer will make coupon payments to bondholders.                         Typically, this is either semi-annual or annual. (number of months between coupons)
params.couponRate: The coupon rate is the annual rate of interest (expressed as a percentage) the bond issuer                         pays out to bondholders on the principal amount of the bond at each coupon payment date. Coupon                         payments compensate investors for the risk of loaning capital to the issuer. (percentage * 100)
params.decimals: The granularity into which a single bond can be tokenized.
params.gateKeeper: The gatekeeper is the smart contract which handles the permissions on this bond.
params.ipfsFieldContainerHash: The IPFS hash to all the fields that are not on chain.
params.maturityPeriod: The maturity period is an amount of months after the issuance date when the bond matures and the                         bond issuer must pay the principal amount to bondholders. (number of months after the issuance date)
params.name: A clear name of for the bond for humans.
params.parCurrency: The currency of the par value
params.parValue: The principal amount is the amount paid out to the holder of the bond at its maturity date.                         It is also known as the par value. The principal amount is the reference amount used to                         calculate interest payments. (amount * 10^decimals of the currency)
params.uiFieldDefinitionsHash: The IPFS hash to the field definitions for the UI

params.couponPeriod: The coupon period is the frequency that the bond issuer will make coupon payments to bondholders.                         Typically, this is either semi-annual or annual. (number of months between coupons)
params.couponRate: The coupon rate is the annual rate of interest (expressed as a percentage) the bond issuer                         pays out to bondholders on the principal amount of the bond at each coupon payment date. Coupon                         payments compensate investors for the risk of loaning capital to the issuer. (percentage * 100)
params.decimals: The granularity into which a single bond can be tokenized.
params.ipfsFieldContainerHash: The IPFS hash to all the fields that are not on chain.
params.maturityPeriod: The maturity period is an amount of months after the issuance date when the bond matures and the                         bond issuer must pay the principal amount to bondholders. (number of months after the issuance date)
params.name: A clear name of for the bond for humans.
params.parCurrency: The currency of the par value
params.parValue: The principal amount is the amount paid out to the holder of the bond at its maturity date.                         It is also known as the par value. The principal amount is the reference amount used to                         calculate interest payments. (amount * 10^decimals of the currency)

getByIndex(uint256).details: Gets balance of an individual bond holder, used by the middleware to build a cache you can query.      You should not need this function in general since iteration this way clientside is very slow.

params.index: used to access the tokenHolders array

getByKey(address).details: Gets balance of an individual bond holder, used by the middleware to build a cache you can query.      You should not need this function in general since iteration this way clientside is very slow.

params.key: used to access the token's balances

getIndexLength().details: Gets the amount of bond holders, used by the middleware to build a cache you can query.      You should not need this function in general since iteration this way clientside is very slow.

returns.length: An uint256 representing the amount of tokenholders recorded in this contract.

increaseApproval(address,uint256).details: approve should be called when allowed[spender] == 0. To increment allowed value it's better to use this function to avoid 2 calls (and wait until the first transaction is mined). From MonolithDAO ERC20Token.sol

params.launchDate: the launch date or announcement date is the date at which the details regarding a new issue                   are released to investors.

redeemCoupons(address).details: Note that this will fail when the contract has not enough currency balance to pay out the entire un-redeemed      balance of the coupon.

params.holder: The address of the account to redeem all unredeemed and vested coupons for.

params.issuanceDate: The date the bond is officially issued. This marks the start of the maturityPeriod (unix timestamp)

claimPar(address).notice: Returns the principal amount to the holder and burns the bond tokens

edit(string,uint256,address,uint256,uint.notice: Updates most of the settings of a bond if the bond has not launched yet and the user had the EDIT_ROLE.

getByIndex(uint256).notice: Returns the address and balance of the tokenholder by index

getByKey(address).notice: Returns the address and balance of the tokenholder by address

getIndexLength().notice: Returns the amount of bond holders.

launch(uint256).notice: Releases the issuance to investors at a certain date and time

redeemCoupons(address).notice: Redeems the coupons for the supplied holder that have not been redeemed yet and have vested.

updateCoupons().notice: Function to run on each transfer, mint, burn and mature (action that changes the holders) to update the coupons         with the holders at that time. It does not matter if there is no movement, because then it will be the current         holder list.

userdoc.notice: A bond is a debt security that corporations and governments use to raise capital. It provides an investor         the means to loan money to an issuer for a defined period of time. In return, the investor will receive variable         or fixed interest payments periodically throughout the loaning period.
